channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: From @WSJopinion: If the U.S. doesn’t improve its logistics systems, defending Taiwan against China will be difficult, writes @sethcropsey https://t.co/XoGS4Xr8RP
The U.S. took its first actions to enforce the bans on the export of technology and industrial goods to Russia in response to the country’s invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/UUxH84ZgWO

India’s Gautam Adani is the newest centibillionaire with a net worth of over $100 billion, joining Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos among the world’s top 10 wealthiest people #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/Wdaibj7rBo https://t.co/j6ERH9MrEE

To keep its supply chain humming, Walmart is raising starting salaries for truck drivers to between $95,000 and $110,000 a year and expanding a training program that enables its employees to enter the field https://t.co/47b8IpbgsB
For Belarusian and Russian volunteers, the path to freedom at home runs through defeating the Russian army in Ukraine https://t.co/X8YQ2ygic0
From Soviet-era systems to drones and shoulder-launched missiles, Ukraine's air offensive has been a surprise trump card against Russia https://t.co/SKoqoebL0C

Turkey is fast becoming a haven for Russian money, from oligarchs parking their superyachts on the country’s shores to young dissidents and tech workers flying from Moscow with cash in suitcases https://t.co/h1Eoiq7RsR
U.S. and European moves to sanction two adult daughters of Russian President Vladimir Putin cast a spotlight on a family shrouded for years in secrecy https://t.co/yrfFpD4CKX

From @WSJopinion: Elon Musk hasn’t disclosed his agenda for Twitter, but for now we’ll consider this a hopeful moment for political speech and debate at America’s increasingly censorious tech giants. https://t.co/BeU9s7CXWe
Kyiv’s residents are emerging from basements and subway stations following Russia’s withdrawal, but remain skeptical that they have seen the last of Russian forces https://t.co/bey2Fhr8sW

We’re finding it difficult to recall simple things: names of friends and co-workers we haven't seen in a while, words that should come easily, even how to perform routine acts. Here's why. https://t.co/kIF0q2WB7O

A surprise Ukrainian strike on a Russian ship at a southern port city last month could curb Moscow’s plan to expand its hold on the Donbas region, eliminating a key military advantage in the Russian attack plan https://t.co/VBQgtmkWew

President Biden signed an executive order on Wednesday that includes a prohibition on new investment in Russia by American investors, as the U.S. expanded sanctions in response to Russian attacks on Ukraine https://t.co/2R9s5jG2RN
Biden administration officials are seeking ways to boost oil imports from Canada, but they don’t want to resurrect the Keystone XL pipeline https://t.co/9Nnnafqcgi
Google has banned dozens of apps from its Google Play store for using hidden software that surreptitiously harvests data https://t.co/gFkupTic5q

Ukraine urged civilians to leave the eastern Donetsk, Luhansk and parts of the Kharkiv regions as it braced for a major new Russian offensive following Moscow’s withdrawal from the north of the country https://t.co/3A1kthBwlZ

Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen told a House committee on Wednesday that she had informed Indonesia, the host of this year's G-20 meetings, that the U.S. would boycott meetings if they involve Russia https://t.co/0pFav5Qlba
U.S. and European moves to sanction two adult daughters of Russian President Vladimir Putin cast a spotlight on a family shrouded for years in secrecy https://t.co/CTtrJCZR7d

U.S. allies are planning to release close to 60 million additional barrels of oil from their reserves, joining the Biden administration in an effort to tame prices that have risen sharply since Russia invaded Ukraine https://t.co/3On3zDpRd1
Elon Musk’s list of responsibilities has grown larger now that he is joining Twitter's board. Here's a look at the board positions held by the billionaire over the years. https://t.co/u75QWYOhZt

Ukraine’s deputy prime minister urged civilians in the country’s east to flee an anticipated Russian offensive. “You need to evacuate now, while this possibility still exists,” she said in a TV appearance. https://t.co/2IyZgmBo38

A surprise Ukrainian strike on a Russian ship at a southern port city last month could curb Moscow’s plan to expand its hold on the Donbas region, eliminating a key military advantage in the Russian attack plan https://t.co/kTvHsNc2em

A quarter of Africa’s population is facing a food-security crisis driven by severe drought, raging wars and a rise in world food prices caused by Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, the International Committee of the Red Cross said Tuesday https://t.co/KVUqd9HOUr
Russia’s repressive laws and arrests that discourage protests against the war in Ukraine have prompted dissenters to leave the country https://t.co/lKT6TgtuSz
Ukrainian forces braced for a major new round of battles in the eastern Donbas region as they consolidated control over the north https://t.co/GkCb1PpADW via @WSJ
Banks, coal imports and two daughters of Vladimir Putin are among the targets of Russian sanctions proposed by the U.S. and Western allies #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/CydGRTd1h8 https://t.co/hHMqb7ZlOj
Twitter's announcement comes after Elon Musk revealed a 9.2% stake in the social media company https://t.co/F11dn6jo1Y
After becoming Hong Kong’s leader in 2017, Carrie Lam vowed to seek unity. Since then, her term has seen protests, a crackdown on dissent and Covid-19 flip flops. https://t.co/deraTfLrWE

From @WSJopinion: Ukrainians have spent the past eight years strengthening their ability to govern themselves, and a vibrant civil society is proving to be a significant advantage in the war against Russia, writes @JillianKayM https://t.co/sih7mpFnIn

French prosecutors have opened an investigation into whether war crimes have been committed in Ukraine following accounts of rape and killings of hundreds of civilians in Bucha and other formerly Russian-occupied towns https://t.co/z8xUm4lAqL
Elon Musk’s Twitter investment raises new regulatory red flag https://t.co/EtcMapzevO
JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon said the U.S. economy is facing unprecedented risks that have him preparing for dramatic upheavals https://t.co/fETTolyvg1
A beloved mayor and her family helped townspeople resist Russian occupation. They paid for it with their lives. https://t.co/GKWrELCfzh

Watch: A WSJ analysis of videos, photos and satellite images from four weeks in March reveals how Russian forces destroyed civilian infrastructure through a series of shellings, with remnants of weapons indicating the use of cluster bombs https://t.co/Wy22J6up5E
The EU is planning to sanction two of Vladimir Putin's daughters, diplomats familiar with the proposal say https://t.co/I8a8sudW7f
The Czech Republic has been sending old Soviet-era tanks into Ukraine, marking the first time a foreign country has provided tanks to Ukraine since Russia’s invasion began https://t.co/UWOFjktE3V
Breaking: JetBlue made an offer to buy Spirit Airlines in an all-cash deal, setting off a potential bidding war with Frontier for the ultra low cost airline https://t.co/sIUmvQYo60

From @WSJopinion: The scenes of murder and mass graves from Bucha and other towns and cities in Ukraine are shocking the world, and we hope they linger in memory for longer than a TikTok video https://t.co/OY0VlpN0IY
A beloved mayor and her family helped townspeople resist Russian occupation. They paid for it with their lives. https://t.co/uITn2Oe36S

Shein, the China-based fast-fashion retailer, is now worth more than H&M and Zara combined, after a funding round valued the startup at $100 billion #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/9wGWAgplhG https://t.co/9Z2zvYGhaQ

The U.S. and the EU are set to unveil new sanctions on Russia this week, after allegations from Ukraine of potential war crimes against civilians by Russian forces galvanized a push for tougher measures against the Kremlin https://t.co/Q0Ix5qlp2L

A Shanghai resident didn’t test positive for Covid-19 or experience any symptoms, but she was ordered to board a bus for a mass quarantine center. Nearly 16 hours later, she hadn’t eaten a bite, sipped any water or gone to the bathroom. https://t.co/ChqvFUmkQl
A Senate panel deadlocked on Ketanji Brown Jackson's nomination to the Supreme Court, forcing a full Senate vote tonight that is expected to move it forward https://t.co/xxX86Sefq9
One of Boeing's new Air Force One planes was hit by a mishap at its factory, people familiar with the matter said. The incident risked damaging the presidential jet. https://t.co/1SQIatn6JC

Twitter said it plans to appoint Tesla CEO Elon Musk to its board of directors a day after he disclosed a 9.2% stake in the social-media company #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/JCv0KApfkX https://t.co/eUnXAocckh
The EU is planning to sanction two of Vladimir Putin's daughters, diplomats familiar with the proposal say https://t.co/xK1NqlQ7MO

GM and Honda say they will work together on underlying technology that would be used to produce several electric models, including compact sport-utility vehicles, for North and South America and China https://t.co/HCgd7k25X1
Biden administration officials are seeking ways to boost oil imports from Canada, but they don’t want to resurrect the Keystone XL pipeline https://t.co/r45hhgFWLq

Watch: A WSJ analysis of videos, photos and satellite images from four weeks in March reveals how Russian forces destroyed civilian infrastructure through a series of shellings, with remnants of weapons indicating the use of cluster bombs https://t.co/8o9UhLRdnH

French prosecutors have opened an investigation into whether war crimes have been committed in Ukraine following accounts of rape and killings of hundreds of civilians in Bucha and other formerly Russian-occupied towns https://t.co/UVStX1BbIz
